questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: What is the purpose of ComfyUI_DanTagGen?
questions_and_answers.answer: ComfyUI_DanTagGen is designed to provide a more convenient way to make prompts for Text2Image models trained on Danbooru datasets by generating Danboou Tags with provided information.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: How can I use ComfyUI_DanTagGen in a workflow in ComfyUI?
questions_and_answers.answer: Load the [example workflow](https://github.com/huchenlei/ComfyUI_DanTagGen/blob/main/examples/dtg.json) and connect the output to `CLIP Text Encode (Prompt)`'s text input. You can also right-click `CLIP Text Encode (Prompt)` to convert in-node text input to external text input.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: What are the recommended tag lengths for using ComfyUI_DanTagGen?
questions_and_answers.answer: Short and long tag lengths are recommended. Short is around 20 tags and long is around 40 tags.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: How can I achieve faster inference with ComfyUI_DanTagGen?
questions_and_answers.answer: Install `llama-cpp-python` by yourself and download the gguf model from HuggingFace, then put them into the `models` folder.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: Are there any resources available for understanding more about `llama-cpp-python`?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, you can refer to these resources for more information about `llama-cpp-python`: * [abetlen/llama-cpp-python: Python bindings for llama.cpp (github.com)](https://github.com/abetlen/llama-cpp-python) * [jllllll/llama-cpp-python-cuBLAS-wheels: Wheels for llama-cpp-python compiled with cuBLAS support (github.com)](https://github.com/jllllll/llama-cpp-python-cuBLAS-wheels)

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_DanTagGen
questions_and_answers.question: Is there a web UI alternative for ComfyUI_DanTagGen?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, the official A1111/Forge extension for DTG can be found here: https://github.com/KohakuBlueleaf/a1111-sd-webui-dtg.
